Issues.Title: Change detection not run when the errors are set on reactive forms
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/forms.... ### Is this a regression? Not sure. ### Description I am on angular 7 and i am using reactive forms for one of my forms and the code is as below. (Stackblitz [Here][1]) **Template**
Error
**Typescript** export class AppComponent implements OnInit { SignupForm: FormGroup; constructor() { } ngOnInit() { setTimeout(() => { this.SignupForm = new FormGroup({ 'username': new FormControl('Value'), 'email': new FormControl() }); this.SignupForm.setErrors({errors: 'Error'}); }) } } As you can see i am trying to set the error as soon as the form is initialized (In my actual case i would do some validation based on back end data and then do this. ). But the error doesn't seem to show up even though `SignupForm.errors` is set with the error object. But if i do setTimeout(() => { this.SignupForm.setErrors({errors: 'Error'});}) Everything works fine. Am i doing something wrong or is it an angular bug which i can report. Please help. Thank you. [1]: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-forms-bug?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts **Use case** Actually the thing is my form comes from the backend which is asynchronous. After the i create the form group from the metadata i do the validation and set the errors. I have used setTimeout on ngOnInit just to depict its asynchronous. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-forms-bug?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** "@angular/common": "^7.2.5", "@angular/compiler": "^7.2.5", "@angular/core": "^7.2.5", "@angular/forms": "^7.2.5", "@angular/platform-browser": "^7.2.5", "@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "^7.2.5", "@angular/router": "^7.2.5", "core-js": "^2.6.5", "rxjs": "^6.4.0", "zone.js": "^0.8.29"
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Change detection not run when the errors are set on reactive forms" (#29515)

Issues.Title: Angular Reactive Forms - Clash with 1Password
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is found in package @angular/reactive-forms ### Is this a regression? Not sure. ### Description When coding up a login form, one of the features commonly used is detecting when the inputs have been "touched". This allows us to only show validation errors on inputs after the user has finished typing in that input box, or switched focus to another DOM element. This usually works OK, except upon some research I realised that a bug that I was experiencing was being caused by the 1Password Chrome extension. For some reason, when the extension is active, it triggers the "onBlur" event (or whatever event) on the input box almost immediately. I was able to compare two browser windows with the exact same environment, with the only difference that on one of those, 1Password was enabled and it was suggesting to autofill a password. In the 1Password window, as soon as the form control is in focus, it's already "dirty" and "touched", which triggers the error messages "email is invalid" to show immediately before the user has even had a chance to type anything. Im not sure how 1Password affects this, but it definitely causes the input element to behave as if it has already been used and lost focus, resulting in error messages showing instantly and affecting the user experience. I suspect it has something to do with the little icon/logo it shows inside the input box that allows users to auto-fill login details. Just to be sure, on the chrome window that didn't have 1Password, the input forms worked as expected. the control stays "untouched" until the user loses focus of the input, only after the user has finished typing and moved on will the form display any errors. I was definitely able to isolate 1Password as the cause. I have already posted in the 1Password support forum here: https://discussions.agilebits.com/discussion/102640/developer-issue-angular-reactive-forms-clash-with-1password/ I'm unsure whose responsibility it is to fix such a bug. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction I was about to code it all up again to reproduce (so just use any reactive form with an input element) but I wouldn't be able to include the browser plugin which causes the bug. I think that the description shows it's quite simple. Steps: 1. Have a reactive form. 2. Include any validation code, and watch the value of "input.touched" 3. Install 1Password extension (a lot of people use this) and watch "input.touched" eval to true as soon as you type anything. Expected Behaviour: "input.touched" should only eval to true AFTER the input loses focus for the first time. Bug: "input.touched" evals to true as soon as you start typing. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** Latest 


Angular CLI: 7.3.5
Node: 11.11.0
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 7.2.9
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... http, language-service, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router, service-worker

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.13.5
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.13.5

MacOS, MacBook Pro 2017, Chrome Browser (Latest), 1Password Extension V1.14.2 PS: I'm sorry if this isn't written properly. It's my first ever bug report for any open source software ever, so go easy on me.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular Reactive Forms - Clash with 1Password" (#29520)

Issues.Title: refactor(ivy): use === instead of == in interpolateV
Issues.Body: Just a minor thing, but in an _extreme corner-case_, code could reset the binding index and incorrectly enter this `if` block if the value at that binding index happened to be falsy. `''` for example.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(ivy): use === instead of == in interpolateV" (#29525)

Issues.Title: ci: lock chrome and firefox versions for saucelabs
Issues.Body:
With 0f1da49b867af60748570b10997fee9d9511424a the Chrome beta job has been disabled because
a new Chrome beta has been released, but Saucelabs didn't support a
chromedriver that is compatible with that given beta version.

Now the topic of pinning these external browsers to a specific version came up.
In order to make the build less prone to unexpected new versions, we need to
_permanently_ disable the Chrome beta browser. Otherwise pinning `SL_CHROME`
or `SL_FIREFOX` to a specific version does not statisfy the requirement of making the
CI jobs more deterministic.

See original discussion: https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/29518#discussion_r269140676

---

* Chrome can be pinned to Chrome v73 (latest stable version at time of this PR)
* Firefox can be pinned to Firefox v65 (latest stable version available in Saucelabs platform)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "ci: lock chrome and firefox versions for saucelabs" (#29529)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): generate empty QueryList for root component content queries
Issues.Body:
In View Engine, we used to generate empty QueryLists for content queries on root
components (though we did not actually support populating these lists). We need
to keep this behavior in Ivy for backwards compatibility. Otherwise, components
that are sometimes used as root will fail if they are relying on content query
results to always be defined.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ivy): generate empty QueryList for root component content queries" (#29514)

Issues.Title: refactor(ivy): make interpolation smaller
Issues.Body:
**NOTE: This is just a proof of concept**

In this refactor, all `interpolationX` methods are refactored to call the same inner implementation. Realizing that all eight of the previous methods existed to reduce the allocation of arrays that you'd have if you have a single method, this refactor uses a shared array in order to reduce the size of the individual instructions, and have all logic flow through a single function.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(ivy): make interpolation smaller" (#29524)

Issues.Title: ReactiveForms: FormGroup.removeControl doesn't call control.setParent(null)
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package `@angular/forms` ### Is this a regression? Most probably no. ### Description The `FormGroup` class' `removeControl` method does not call `setParent(null)` for the target control. This appears to be an inconsistency in the implementation. Our expectation is that `removeControl` would call `control.setParent(null)`, to clear the control's parent once detached. This would also make it symmetric with `addControl`. #### Use case We have a dynamic form implementation where a class extending `FormGroup` is dynamically attaching/detaching child groups/controls using `addControl`/`removeControl`. The controls can react to their inclusion/exclusion in their `setParent` method (to e.g. subscribe to a parent's `attachedState` observable). Since we're extending `FormGroup` this is easy to work around by just overriding `removeControl`, but IMHO the inconsistency in the framework should be fixed. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction The call is missing from: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/forms/src/model.ts#L1298 . ## üî• Exception or Error None. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version: 7.2.0** 

Angular CLI: 7.3.0
Node: 10.15.3
OS: win32 x64
**Anything else relevant?** No.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ReactiveForms: FormGroup.removeControl doesn't call control.setParent(null)" (#29517)

# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description

I‚Äôm very glad that we have a Guide for `app-shell` now (https://next.angular.io/guide/app-shell via https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/28591)! However, it seems less polished than some of the other guides.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

### What's the affected URL?**
https://next.angular.io/guide/app-shell

### Reproduction Steps**

- Typos like ‚ÄúFor an existing application, you have to manually add the RouterModule and **defining** a <router-outlet>‚Äú.
- It seems like there should be a `Step 1a` and `Step 1b` with example snippets for an existing application
- For `Step 2`
  - `my-app` takes the name of your client application.
  - `server-app` takes the name of the Universal (or server) application.
  - These seem to be just repeating what‚Äôs on the command line example above. Should we be referencing the `--client-project` and `--universal-project` instead of `my-app` and `server-app` here?
  - It seems like there needs to be more explanation of where a developer would go to find these names.
- `Step 3` helps you verify that `ng run app-shell` works, but what about `Step 4` where you integrate this with your normal build, deploy, and verify this? If that gets too complicated, is there a section in the Universal docs that we should be pointing them to?
  - i.e. do they run that before or after `ng run my-app:app-shell`? should they do something like this? `"build:prod": "ng build --prod && ng run my-app:app-shell",`
  - or does `ng build --prod` already handle this and they don‚Äôt need to know about `ng run my-app:app-shell`?

### Expected vs Actual Behavior**
See above.

N/A


## üî• Exception or Error
N/A


## üåç  Your Environment

Issues.Title: ngFor over complex data does not work for custom-elements in IE and Edge (freeze)
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package `@angular/core` ### Is this a regression? Not testet in older Version ### Description If you iterate over a complex array (array consisting of Objects) on an custom-element with *ngFor and the custom element deffers a render/update in a task or microtask angular freezes on IE11 and Edge. If you iterate over an array of basic-types everything works fine. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Repository to reproduce: https://github.com/mzeiher/ngFor-custom-element-bug Custom Elements defined here (one which renders directly, one defers render to a microtask, one defers render to a setTimeout): https://github.com/mzeiher/ngFor-custom-element-bug/blob/master/src/app/app.component.ts Angular Template: https://github.com/mzeiher/ngFor-custom-element-bug/blob/master/src/app/app.component.html just run `npm start`, un-comment line 5 and 6 in `app.component.html` and startup Edge or Internet Explorer 11. The page freezes, looks like the renderer is stuck in an endless loop (if the render is defered to a microtask the browser obviously freezes, if defered to a setTimeout the render just re-renders in an endless loop) ## üî• Exception or Error 

IE11 and Edge freeze, renderer stuck in endless loop
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 7.3.6
Node: 11.12.0
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 7.2.10
Source code is ES5, @webcomponents/webcomponentsjs polyfill is loaded for Edge and IE If you need more code sample just let me know it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ngFor over complex data does not work for custom-elements in IE and Edge (freeze)" (#29510)

Issues.Title: Angular animation: :enter & :leave have non-symmetric behavior
Issues.Body:
### Affected Package
@angular/animations

### Description
:enter animation works, while :leave does not for child components of *ngFor
I believe that the behavior should be symmetric.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-qcqfdk?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts

## üåç  Your Environment
Chrome 73

**Angular Version:**
7.2.5

**Anything else relevant?**
There is a workaround to make :leave animation to work by adding 
` trigger('animateChild', [
      transition(':enter, :leave', [query('@*', animateChild())])
    ]),`
trigger either to *ngFor or to a child component.

or by moving animation trigger from the child component to the *ngFor element.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular animation: :enter & :leave have non-symmetric behavior" (#29509)

Issues.Title: Script bundle does not include sourcemaps
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x ] build - [x ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? No ### Description When you create a script bundle with the "scripts" config in angular.json, the generated sourcemap does not take in account the existing sourcemap in those scripts. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ng new myapp create a folder lib with a dummy mylib.ts file 

namespace Lib {
    export class App {
        init() {
            setTimeout(() => console.log('Hello'));
        }
    }
}
And a tsconfig.json file, enabling TypeScript sourcemap : 

{
    "compileOnSave": false,
    "compilerOptions": {
      "outFile": "./build/mylib.js",
      "sourceMap": true,
      "declaration": true,
      "emitDecoratorMetadata": true,
      "experimentalDecorators": true,
      "moduleResolution": "node",
      "target": "es5",
      "typeRoots": [
        "node_modules/@types"
      ],
      "lib": [
        "es6",
        "dom"
      ]
    }
  }
Build your dummy lib with a tsc command in lib folder. Then update angular.json config to enable sourcemap and embed the script : 

...
           "scripts": [
              "lib/build/mylib.js"
            ],
            "sourceMap": true
...
## üî• Exception or Error When you launch the app with ng serve or ng build, the sourcemap available in devtools is mylib.js, the built code, whereas I would have expected to retrieve my initial lib TS file, which is available if I include directly the library in index.html. Scripts.js : 

var Lib;
(function (Lib) {
    var App = /** @class */ (function () {
        function App() {
        }
        App.prototype.init = function () {
            setTimeout(function () { return console.log('Hello'); });
        };
        return App;
    }());
    Lib.App = App;
})(Lib || (Lib = {}));
//# sourceMappingURL=mylib.js.map
;
//# sourceMappingURL=scripts.js.map
## üåç Your Environment 


Angular CLI: 7.3.6
Node: 8.11.1
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 7.2.10

Issues.Title: Telemetry various fix
Issues.Body:
The prompt was never shown to the user because of a combination of issues;

1. the "scripts" key in package.json is not kept during building.
1. when a user lack a global configuration file, we return as if the user answered false (because it's `null`, not `undefined`).
1. prompting on non-tty terminals also meant that CI was broken.

This fixes those issues.

Issues.Title: Angular CLI doesn't detect changes/references in files used by importing 'index.ts' in angular and don't recompiling project
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? No ### Description In AppComponent the IPerson1 interface is imported by index. Probably visual studio doesn't detect references to the file and doesn't recompile the project when changing and saving the file. The interface "IPerson2" is imported directly and recompile works. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. Create Angular project 2. Add new folder "person" 3. Add file iperson1.ts to "person" folder ``` export interface IPerson1 { name: string; age: number; } ``` 4. Add file IPerson2 to "person" folder ``` export interface iperson2.ts { name: string; age: number; } ``` 5. Add ile index.ts to "person" folder ``` export * from './iperson'; export * from './iperson2'; ``` 6. Add this code to AppComponent: ``` import { IPerson1 } from './person'; import { IPerson2 } from './person/iperson2'; ``` ``` person: IPerson1 = { age: 20, name: 'Karl' }; person2: IPerson2 = { age: 21, name: 'Tomas' }; ``` 7. Start project: _npm start_ 8. Change something in iperson1.ts and save. Project is not recompiled. 9. Change something in iperson2.ts and save. Project is recompiled. ![vscode2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5776195/53482781-4fc44b00-3a80-11e9-9cc9-66f981f4f09c.gif) ## üåç Your Environment

Node: 10.15.1
OS: win32 x64

Issues.Title: Angular Dev Kit 8.x.x: make server and karma builder reusable by external developers
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [x] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
The new Architect API is almost here and it takes into consideration external developers such as myself (@hansl great job!).  
For instance, there is `transforms` object in [browser](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/browser/index2.ts#L212) and [dev-server](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/dev-server/index2.ts#L77) builders which allows me to easily extend them with custom webpack configuration ([custom-webpack:browser](https://github.com/meltedspark/angular-builders/blob/new-architect-api/packages/custom-webpack/src/browser/index2.ts), [custom-webpack:dev-server](https://github.com/meltedspark/angular-builders/blob/new-architect-api/packages/custom-webpack/src/dev-server/index.ts)).  
It made the transition from 7.x.x to 8.x.x very easy end the API itself is very robust.  
However, this is not the case for karma and server builders (which are must-have to complete the transition).   
The only function I can reuse from [server](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/server/index2.ts) builder is [`buildServerWebpackConfig`](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/server/index2.ts#L107) but even with this reuse I have to copy&modify the rest of the logic.  
When it comes to [karma](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/karma/index2.ts) builder I don't think I can reuse anything from there, meaning I have to copy&modify the whole file.  

### Describe the solution you'd like
Karma and Server builders should provide the same level of flexibility and behave similarly to Browser and Dev-Server builders.  
In particular, take in the `transforms` object, export the logic that can be potentially reused by external developers and use the same way for creating a builder (`createBuilder` function from `'@angular-devkit/architect/src/index2'` and not something custom like [here](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/server/index2.ts#L44)).
### Describe alternatives you've considered
The only alternative I have today is to copy and paste the code from Karma and Server builder and start modifying it.  
I hope we all agree that this is very hard to maintain and can't be a long term option.  
In fact, it would be really great if I didn't have to do it and I could reuse all the necessary logic before the RC is out.  

@clydin @mgechev Guys, @hansl told me that I should ask you for help about the coordination so here I'm asking.  
We can discuss it here, or if you need more details I'm on `#tools-friends` channel at Slack.

Thanks a lot for doing such an amazing job!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular Dev Kit 8.x.x: make server and karma builder reusable by external developers" (#13972)

Issues.Title: feat(@ngtools/webpack): add NGCC as part of the workflow
Issues.Body:
- feat(@schematics/angular): remove ivy-ngcc postinstall script from new application
- refactor(@ngtools/webpack): move interfaces to separate file
This is to avoid circular imports

- feat(@ngtools/webpack): add NGCC as part of the workflow  ‚Ä¶
When add module is resolved, it will try to convert the module using the `NGCC` API. Also, this add a helper method `getMainFields` to be used externally to compute that mainFields based on several criteria s such as Platform, enableIvy and Script Target.

- test: add e2e test for ivy opt-out

- refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): use `@ngtools/webpack` getMainFields helper
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@ngtools/webpack): add NGCC as part of the workflow" (#13968)

Issues.Title: raw-loader not working with "aot": true and "buildOptimizer": true
Issues.Body:
Currently in my components I have code like 
```
import * as leftMenuTemplate from '!raw-loader!./templates/_left-menu.html';

@Component({
selector: 'my-component',
template: `
    <aside class="main-sidebar">
      <section class="sidebar">${leftMenuTemplate}</section>
    </aside>
   `
})
```
everything works fine if I build with  "aot": false and "buildOptimizer": false but everything fails if I build with "aot": true and "buildOptimizer": true

**_When I try to run with AOT true I get the null string rendered instead of my menu._**

Issues.Title: Resolves mat-form-fields not matching Material color specs for hovering
Issues.Body:
For mat-form-field elements being hovered (for fill, standard and outline appearances), the underline does not match that of the Google Material Spec. This PR should resolve that issue.

See Github Issue: https://github.com/angular/material2/issues/15583

Attached screenshots demonstrate the old behavior versus the new behavior on hovering (the cursor is not visible, but hovering is occurring):
Filled Now:

Outline Now:
![outline_after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48806285/55037182-1e389400-4fda-11e9-9a48-a925e994a8e2.png)
Outline Before:
![outline_before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48806285/55037183-1e389400-4fda-11e9-86f5-2edecdcd19c6.png)

Standard Now:
![standard_after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48806285/55037184-1ed12a80-4fda-11e9-9872-1006f2eea436.png)
Standard Before:
![standard_before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48806285/55037186-1ed12a80-4fda-11e9-83e7-15d3c144a5fa.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Resolves mat-form-fields not matching Material color specs for hovering" (#15618)

Issues.Title: feat(option): add Input to remove aria-selected='false'
Issues.Body:
Add an Input to optionally remove the aria-selected attribute from unselected options.
The default behavior is unchanged. Motivation: the screen reader NVDA announces 'not selected'
on any element that has aria-selected='false', which is disruptive when a user is navigating
through a long list of options. The W3 aria best practices example only uses aria-selected='true',
false is implicit:
https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices/examples/listbox/listbox-collapsible.html
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(option): add Input to remove aria-selected='false'" (#15617)

Issues.Title: fix(autocomplete): unable to open panel via click inside shadow dom
Issues.Body:
Fixes clicking on an input to open its autocomplete not working if the consumer is using `ViewEncapsulation.ShadowDom`. The issue comes from the fact that inside the shadow DOM the `event.target` is set to the shadow root, rather than the element being clicked.

Fixes #15606.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(autocomplete): unable to open panel via click inside shadow dom" (#15616)

Issues.Title: build: staging script should ignore pre-commit hook
Issues.Body:
Currently if the caretaker stages a new release but does not have the
`git-clang-format` pre-commit hook configured properly (there is some
additional configuration involved), the staging script will fail.

In order to avoid these unexpected failures, we just ignore the pre-commit hook
when a commit is created automatically by the release scripts. The release script
only makes changes which _conform_ with clang-format / the project's style
guidelines.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: staging script should ignore pre-commit hook" (#15612)

Issues.Title: build: use older rules_nodejs version with uglify
Issues.Body:
We recently updated to a more recent "rules_nodejs" version that
no longer runs with `uglify`. This is problematic as we didn't update
the `@angular/bazel` package. Our current version of `@angular/bazel`
depends on the rollup-uglify build targets in the NodeJS Bazel repository.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: use older rules_nodejs version with uglify" (#15613)

Issues.Title: Components that inject ANIMATION_MODULE_TYPE broken in e2e app

1. Run ` bazel run src/e2e-app:devserver`
2. Open http://localhost:4200
3. Click "Toggle Navigation Links"

```
    at Object.createEmbeddedView (bundle.js:82528)
    at TemplateRef_.createEmbeddedView (bundle.js:74572)
    at ViewContainerRef_.createEmbeddedView (bundle.js:74438)
    at NgIf._updateView (bundle.js:24218)
    at NgIf.set [as ngIf] (bundle.js:24180)
    at updateProp (bundle.js:75133)
    at checkAndUpdateDirectiveInline (bundle.js:74884)
```

This issue means we have had to disable e2e tests for the following components:
- Expansion panel
- List
- Menu
- Stepper
- Tabs
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Components that inject ANIMATION_MODULE_TYPE broken in e2e app" (#15614)

Issues.Title: refactor: fix v8 material imports update rule
Issues.Body:
* Fixes that the V8 `updateAngularMaterialImportsRule` does currently not work (due to incorrect resolution of the value declaration source file)
* Fixes that aliased imports are transformed into non-alias imports (e.g. `import {a as b} from ..` turns into `import {a} from ...`)
* Fixes that inline comments within the module specifiers are omitted.
* Adds a test-case that ensures that the rule properly works
* Slightly refactors the test-case setup so that we can modify the test-case temporary dirctory before running the fixers.

Issues.Title: build: do not ship schematic data typescript sources to npm
Issues.Body:
In the early stages of the schematics the upgrade data was
stored in `.json` files. We switched these data files to TypeScript
at some point, but didn't update the schematic-copy glob. Meaning
that we currently ship TypeScript source files within the `data/` folder
to NPM for the CDK and Material schematics.

Issues.Title: build: no longer install angular dev dependencies
Issues.Body:
No longer sets up the "@angular" repository. As we no longer
build from source we don't need to install the NPM dev dependencies
from the Angular project.

This is now possible as Angular switched away from the "@ngdeps"
repository to the "@npm" repository.

**Note**: Until the TypeScript update PR landed, we need to keep the compiler-cli version locked to an older version. This shouldn't be a problem as the TS PR should land soon.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: no longer install angular dev dependencies" (#15599)

Issues.Title: Autocomplete is broken in Angular elements
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Focusing `matInput` should show autocomplete options when Angular application used as custom element.

#### What is the current behavior?
Focusing `matInput` showing and instantly hiding autocomplete options when Angular application used as custom element.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material2-issue-vx5mxk
Example above - the simpliest case of using the app as custom element.
Row `encapsulation: ViewEncapsulation.ShadowDom` in the `app.component.ts` makes the autocomplete bug.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
All

#### Is there anything else we should know?
This problem hidden in `_getOutsideClickStream` function in `autocomplete-trigger.ts` file.
In this function `event.target` always have custom element tag as value.
Also `formField.contains(clickTarget)` result false.
These variables makes return result of filter (in line 329) false positive.
That's why autocomplete options list instantly closing.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Autocomplete is broken in Angular elements" (#15606)

Issues.Title: checkbox ID has increment BUG
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
when click checkbox it gets checked


#### What is the current behavior?
when click checkbox the next adjacent checkbox gets checked

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
sorry no repo


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
```
Angular CLI: 7.3.6
Node: 8.12.0
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 7.2.10
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... http, language-service, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.13.6
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.13.6
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.13.6
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.13.6
@angular-devkit/core              7.3.6
@angular-devkit/schematics        7.3.6
@angular/cdk                      7.3.5

@angular/material                 7.3.5

@schematics/update                0.13.6
rxjs                              6.4.0
typescript                        3.2.4
webpack                           4.29.0
```

#### Is there anything else we should know?
its been in the code for past year

I have bit the bullet to isolate it finally

after chomping on inputs [ngModel] and [checked]
and crafting all the ways of doing ID's

I omitted all

and allowed material 2 to generate its own ID

and when I align my bitset of bits to retain state of all my checkboxes
the bitset reflects 0..n checkboxes fines and state is retained check and uncheck

but the markup is NOT being checked by material

I figured ID's generated for each checkbox would start with indice 0

to align with my bitset 0..10

only to find someone coded material to generate internal ID's

so when I check my checkbox 0 of 0..10

id's internally are generated mat-checkbox-1, mat-checkbox-2, mat-checkbox-3, ... N

and everytime I check my first checkbox

the subsequent next checkbox is the one being checked on my user interface component template


if someone could fix this

I do not have a workaround for am working on trying that now but have not gotten a workaround

refer to code like this in material

  private _uniqueId: string = `mat-checkbox-${++nextUniqueId}`;

either they are not considering indice 0
or they are pre-incrementing it errantly on the active checkbox instance
either way material checkbox not working and im surprised this hasnt been flagged yet
their ID logic IS being operated on internally in order to determine which checkbox gets checked
thats where the fix needs to be performed

a workaround would be appreciated


here are some snippets

```
                <mat-checkbox *ngFor="let bit of bits.getArray(); let i = index"
                              [labelPosition]="'after'"
                              class="example-margin"
                              (change)="onCheck($event)"
                >
                    {{i}}
                </mat-checkbox>
```

Issues.Title: Drag-and-drop disabled inputs not working
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?

Drap-and-drop of disabled elements should be possible. Drag-and-drop should only be disabled by [cdkDragDisabled], not by the HTML "disabled" attribute.

#### What is the current behavior?

**cdkDrag on inputs**

- With cdkDrag on inputs, drag-and-drop is working as expected.
- With cdkDrag and cdkDragDisabled on inputs, drag-and-drop is blocked as expected.
- With cdkDrag on **disabled** inputs (HTML disabled attribute), drag-and-drop is **not** working. **This is not what I did expect according to the CDK documentation** which states drag-and-drop is disabled by [cdkDragDisabled].

**cdkDrag on a div wrapping inputs**

- With cdkDrag on a div wrapping inputs, drag-and-drop is working as expected.
- With cdkDrag on a div wrapping **disabled** inputs (HTML disabled attribute), drag-and-drop is working on Chrome and Internet Explorer. However, it is NOT working on Firefox and Edge. The behavior is here **inconsistent across browsers**.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?

Here is a stackblitz project to reproduce these 5 different cases : 
[https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-dhlkfm](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-dhlkfm)

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?

Angular 7.2.10, CDK 7.3.5, Material 7.3.5, TypeScript 3.2.4.

Browsers used for these tests (all desktop Win10 versions) :

- Chrome 72
- Firefox 66
- Microsoft EdgeHTML 17.17134
- Internet Explorer 17.648.17134.0

#### Is there anything else we should know?

I've got bad news : your Google Chrome browser behavior is identical to the very-old-and-obsolete Internet Explorer :-)

Beside this joke, I'm using drag-and-drop to let the app user configure which fields of a search bar are displayed and which are not. During the "configuration" mode (which is enabling drag-and-drop), I do not want the user to be able to enter values within the search inputs. For this reason, I need the input fields to be disabled during this configuration process.

I could not think about much options to work around this problem. The only option I can think of is to add a drag handle within the div wrapper, but this means my drag-and-drop elements are increasing in size, which I would rather avoid if possible.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Drag-and-drop disabled inputs not working" (#15592)
